ptserver.data.handler

Interface TokenHandler<T extends Token>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - Type of Token that the handler handles.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ArrayTokenHandler, AttributeChangeTokenHandler, BooleanTokenHandler, ByteArrayTokenHandler, CommunicationTokenHandler, ComplexMatrixTokenHandler, ComplexTokenHandler, DoubleMatrixTokenHandler, DoubleTokenHandler, FloatTokenHandler, IntMatrixTokenHandler, IntTokenHandler, LongMatrixTokenHandler, LongTokenHandler, PingPongTokenHandler, RecordTokenHandler, RemoteEventTokenHandler, ShortTokenHandler, StringTokenHandler, UnionTokenHandler, UnsignedByteTokenHandler

    public interface TokenHandler<T extends Token>
    Convert a token of a particular type to a byte stream and back.
    Since:
    Ptolemy II 10.0
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    ahuseyno
    Accepted Rating:
    Red (ahuseyno)
    Proposed Rating:
    Red (ahuseyno)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void convertToBytes(T token, java.io.DataOutputStream outputStream)
      Convert the token to a byte stream according to the handler's parsing algorithm and output it to the outputStream.
      T convertToToken(java.io.DataInputStream inputStream, java.lang.Class<? extends T> tokenType)
      Return a token of the specified type by reading from the inputStream and converting to the token according to the parsing algorithm defined in the handler.

    • Method Detail

      • convertToBytes

        void convertToBytes(T token,
                    java.io.DataOutputStream outputStream)
             throws java.io.IOException,
                    IllegalActionException
        Convert the token to a byte stream according to the handler's parsing algorithm and output it to the outputStream.
        Parameters:
        token - the token to be converted
        outputStream - the outputStream holding stream of bytes
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is a problem with the outputStream
        IllegalActionException - if there is the state becomes inconsistent

      • convertToToken

        T convertToToken(java.io.DataInputStream inputStream,
                 java.lang.Class<? extends T> tokenType)
          throws java.io.IOException,
                 IllegalActionException
        Return a token of the specified type by reading from the inputStream and converting to the token according to the parsing algorithm defined in the handler.
        Parameters:
        inputStream - The inputStream that contains serialized version of a token
        tokenType - the type of token to be read.
        Returns:
        Token parsed from inputStream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is a problem with the outputStream
        IllegalActionException - if there is the state becomes inconsistent
